response_parsed.title: Testing Strategies for PDB Code with pytest (Python 3.12+)
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to effectively test Python Debugger (PDB) code using the popular testing framework, pytest. It covers key points, code examples, version notes, and caveats.
key_points: Writing test cases to handle PDB interactions
Isolating PDB usage within test functions

code_examples.code:
def test_isolated_pdb_usage():
    with pytest.monkeypatch.context(
            asserts=pytest.assertion.rewrite):
        original_pdb = pdb.Pdb
        pdb.Pdb = MockPdb
        # Your test function here
        pdb.Pdb = original_pdb

version_notes: Pytest version 7.0 and above is required for this example.
Python 3.12 is the recommended Python version for this tutorial.
caveats: Isolating PDB usage within test functions may not always be possible or feasible depending on your codebase.
Remember to carefully handle and revert any mocks or patches used in tests after they've served their purpose.
